channel.title: project on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in project on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Pricing model: Bill by hours
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We are all aware of the uncertain economy, as well as the long funding winter in the tech market. These forces have led to companies being extremely cautious with their tech budgeting and resources.

item.title: Collaboration Guideline
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Guidelines for project collaboration between DF and Clients. Tools Project management & communication: Basecamp (invited as Client) Sprint planning & tracking: Jira/Basecamp Meeting: Google Meet Source control platform: Github/Gitlab (self-hosted) Design: Figma/Sketch Schedule Project kick-off meeting: 1 session Sprint length: 1 week/2 weeks Sprint planning meeting: 1 per sprint Sprint review & retrospective meeting: 1 per sprint Sprint daily standup meetings (can as well be done via communication channel or Basecamp’s check-ins) Project/team feedback meeting (with Account Manager): 1 per week or 1 every 2 weeks Meeting notes for Sprint planning and Sprint retrospective will be sent within 30 minutes after meeting.

item.title: How to work with clients
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: TRAINING COURSE: HOW TO WORK WITH CLIENT What skills that an engineer should have in order to work with client effectively?

item.title: Service Feedbacks
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: GENERAL QUESTIONS FOR SERVICE FEEDBACKS Engineer performances a. Communication How did the engineer interact with your team? How was the communication between the engineer and your team?

item.title: Project Archive
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Project: Archive Collect and put all artifact to Google Drive. Write a case study to share experience. Thank you and ask for referral if possible.

item.title: Project Case Study
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The case study should focus on what the audience want to read Non tech Client The clients want to know if you have capability to deliver their things

item.title: Project Communication
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Transparency Email communication should follow email communication and use. Work related discussion which is common knowledge for the team must be discussed in the public/shared channel In case the work related discussion which is common knowledge for the team is unintentionally chat privately, the person should update with the related people or the rest of the team Professionalism

item.title: Project Handover
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Source code Detailed diagrams created. Source code up to standard. All tests must be passed prior to the handover. Provide HOW-TOs to guide the new member to the development process.

item.title: Project Initialization
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Paperwork NDA (depends on clients) Legally signed Agreements (hellosign.com for the e-contract) All related papers such as agreements are put on Drive Process

item.title: Project Compliance
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hey, It’s Han & Nikki from Team Dwarves. This email is the third month we share about our journey to Software Craftsmanship.

item.title: Setting The Budget
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: One of the most important questions at the start of a project is how much it will cost. It is vital to make sure that enough budget is available to allow for the development of a viable product.

item.title: Annual bonus for sales
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The annual bonus for sales are the sum of 2 portions New deals of current year The annual will be calculated based on the total commission you earn that year.

item.title: Bunk license check
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: License detector tool: Glice Golang license and dependency checker. Prints list of all dependencies (both from std and 3rd party), number of times used, their license and saves all the license files in /licenses.

item.title: Collaboration Guidelines
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Guidelines for project collaboration between Dwarves and our Clients. Tools Project management & communication: Basecamp (invited as Client) Sprint planning & tracking: Jira/Basecamp Meeting: Google Meet Source control platform: Github/Gitlab (self-hosted) Design: Figma/Sketch Schedule Project kick-off meeting: 1 session Sprint length: 1 week/2 week Sprint planning meeting: 1 per sprint Sprint review & retrospective meeting: 1 per sprint Sprint daily standup meetings (can as well be done via a communication channel or Basecamp’s check-ins) Project/team feedback meeting (with Account Manager): 1 per week or 1 every 2 weeks Meeting notes for Sprint planning and Sprint retrospective will be sent within 30 minutes after the meeting.

item.title: Compliance Check Process
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Compliance Checklist Compliance master list is stored here. Compliance execution Compliance check will be done in the monthly basis:
